A Demonstrative Example ScriptÂ¶

During the course of my work, I often have to run a selection of data analysis tasks in order to keep tabs on my simulation as it runs. I’ve included below a script that I run on each output as it is created.

import sys
import yt.lagos as lagos
import yt.raven as raven

fn = sys.argv[-1]
pf = lagos.EnzoStaticOutput(fn)
pf.h.print_stats()

fields_to_plot = ["NumberDensity", "Density", "Temperature", "H2I_Fraction"]

my_vals = [1000.0, 100.0, 10.0, 1.0]
my_units = ['au','rsun']

my_widths = []

for unit in my_units:
    my_widths += [(v,units) for v in my_vals]

pc = raven.PlotCollection(pf)
for i in range(3): pc.add_slice("NumberDensity", i)

for field in fields_to_plot:
    pc.switch_field(field)
    for w, u in my_widths:
        pc.set_width(w,u)
        pc.save("%s" % pf)

And that’s it!
